column4: Using sudo always returns an error "sudo: must be setuid root"
is your user in the sudoers file?
what do you mean
usually if sudo gives an error it's cos the user isn't authenticated to have sudoers access
verify that your user is listed in /etc/sudoers
Only user previlege specification : root ALL=(ALL) ALL
in sudoers you want your user added
it should loook: USER_NAME   ALL=(ALL) ALL
where username represents your user
I dont have admin in User settings, its not letting me authenticate
that would do it too, the gui end just puts you in sudoers
do you have another user naem that was generated when you installed ubuntu?
I guess the user previlege is shown as custom
I need to change it to admin, but its not letting me authenticate
can i use root

are you using another user beyond what was set up on install, though? Cos usually your default is set sudoers authenticated... And root can be used, but you'd need to be able to access sudoers before that's an option really.
an unahtenticated user cannot gain access without su'ing to a user with proper permissions
i have many users
i think it is not recognising my user as an admin
I'd go to your first user; your initial one from install, and set your current user as admin/sudoers
so i need to use root to change it somehow
